generated_json.title: History of Present Illness
content: The patient reports persistent right leg pain localized to the anterior thigh, associated with weakness in the right quadriceps, noted as 2/5 strength. She describes a history of lumbar stenosis at L3-4, which is contributing to her symptoms. The onset of symptoms began around late June 2023, with progressive worsening over time. She has experienced 16 falls since symptom onset, including a recent fall down the stairs. The patient reports difficulty straightening her leg, inability to drive due to lack of control, and requires bracing for mobility. She has been unable to perform daily activities independently and now relies on hired help for household tasks. Prior interventions include a steroid injection for tendon inflammation, which provided no relief. She has also undergone evaluation by a neurosurgeon and radiation oncologist, with plans for a PET scan on August 24, 2023, to assess for metastatic disease progression. The patient has a history of breast cancer diagnosed in 2010, with recurrence in the bones in 2018. Bone metastases have been stable on imaging to date. The patient is currently undergoing radiation therapy and is awaiting further treatment decisions. She expresses concern about the timing of surgical intervention and the potential for spinal stabilization during surgery. She is anxious about her condition and fears further injury.

content: M54.16 - Lumbar spinal stenosis, lumbar region, with neurogenic claudication
C79.51 - Secondary malignant neoplasm of spine
Z51.89 - Encounter for other specified aftercare
M62.85 - Other specified muscle weakness

sub-section.title: Plan
content: Proceed with surgical intervention for L3-4 lumbar stenosis with possible spinal fusion and instrumentation.
Consider simultaneous stabilization of vertebral body with cages and screws due to presence of bone metastases and risk of fracture.
Administer vertebroplasty with bone cement to stabilize the affected vertebra if deemed appropriate.
Coordinate with oncology team to ensure timing of surgery aligns with radiation therapy schedule.
Continue current bone-modifying therapy for metastatic disease.
Initiate physical therapy postoperatively to improve strength and mobility.
Provide patient education on fall prevention, home safety modifications, and use of assistive devices.
Prescribe pain management regimen as needed, including non-opioid and adjuvant analgesics.
sub-section.instruction: Detail the healthcare provider's plan of action to manage the patient's condition, specifying treatments, medications (include ongoing medications briefly), procedures, therapies, lifestyle modifications, referrals to specialists, patient education on condition and medications, and recommendations for counselings or support services. Dont provide any follow up details in this section, provide everything in a list.
